name: Modules.Map.Annotation
summary: Represents a labeled point of interest on the map that the user can click on.

parameters.name: newLocation
parameters.summary: latitude and longitude where annotation will animate.

properties.name: annotationDisplayPriority
properties.summary: The display priority of this annotation view.
properties.description: An annotation view whose priority is set to MKFeatureDisplayPriorityRequired is always visible on the map, whereas other priorities may result in the annotation view being hidden. Use FEATURE_DISPLAY_PRIORITY_REQUIRED, FEATURE_DISPLAY_PRIORITY_DEFAULT_HIGH or FEATURE_DISPLAY_PRIORITY_DEFAULT_LOW.

properties.name: canShowCallout
properties.summary: Defines whether the annotation view is able to display extra information in a callout bubble.
properties.description:
When this is set to true, the annotation view shows the callout bubble on selection. Set this to false to disabled the showing of the callout bubble on selection. This must be set before the annotation is added to the map.

If this value is undefined, the value is treated as explicit true.

properties.name: centerOffset
properties.summary: Defines a center offset point for the annotation.
properties.description: By default, the center point of an annotation view is placed at the coordinate point of the associated annotation. Use this property to reposition the annotation view as needed. Positive offset values move the annotation view down and right, while negative values move it up and left.

properties.name: clusterIdentifier
properties.summary: An identifier that determines whether the annotation view participates in clustering.
properties.description: The default value of this property is null, which prevents the annotation view from being clustered with other annotation views. Setting the property to a non null value it to participate in clustering. Clustering occurs when there is a collision between multiple annotation views with the same identifier on the map surface. The annotation views involved in the collision are removed from the map view and replaced by a clustering annotation view, which displays the title from one of the annotations and provides access to the other annotations.

properties.name: collisionMode
properties.summary: The collision mode to use when interpreting the collision frame rectangle.
properties.description: Use ANNOTATION_VIEW_COLLISION_MODE_RECTANGLE or ANNOTATION_VIEW_COLLISION_MODE_CIRCLE.

properties.name: customView
properties.summary: Defines a custom view to be used by the annotation.
properties.description: Must be set during creation. User interaction is disabled on the view. No view interaction events (click, touchstart etc) will be fired.

properties.name: draggable
properties.summary: Determines whether the pin can be dragged by the user.
properties.description: When an annotation is draggable, it can be moved by the user by long pressing on the pin.

properties.name: hidden
properties.summary: Determines whether the annotation is hidden or not.

properties.name: image
properties.summary: Image to use for the the pin.
properties.description: Must be set during creation. This is ignored if the customView property is set.
properties.default: If not specified, a standard map pin image is used.

properties.name: latitude
properties.summary: Latitude of the annotation, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: leftButton
properties.summary: Left button image on the annotation, specified as an image URL.

properties.name: leftView
properties.summary: Left view that is displayed on the annotation.
properties.description: This is ignored if the leftButton property is set.

properties.name: longitude
properties.summary: Longitude of the annotation, in decimal degrees.

properties.name: markerAnimatesWhenAdded
properties.summary: Boolean indicating whether the marker animates into position onscreen.

properties.name: markerColor
properties.summary: The background color of the marker balloon.
properties.description: The default value of this property is undefined, which applies the standard color that is appropriate for the current map style.

properties.name: markerGlyphColor
properties.summary: The color to apply to the glyph text or image.
properties.description: The default value of this property is undefined, which applies the standard tint color for the current map style.

properties.name: markerGlyphImage
properties.summary: The image displayed in the marker balloon.
properties.description: Use this property or the markerGlyphText property to specify the marker balloon content. If you specify both an image and text, the text is displayed. The glyph image is displayed when the marker is in the normal state. Create glyph images as template images so that the glyph tint color can be applied to it. Normally, you set the size of this image to 20 by 20 points on iOS. However, if you do not provide a separate selected image in the markerSelectedGlyphImage property, make the size of this image 40 by 40 points on iOS. MapKit scales images that are larger or smaller than those sizes.

properties.name: markerGlyphText
properties.summary: The text to display in the marker balloon.
properties.description: Use this property or the markerGlyphImage property to specify the marker balloon content. If you specify both an image and text, the text is displayed. The amount of space available for displaying your glyph text is limited. Specify no more than two or three characters for any strings you assign to this property.

properties.name: markerSelectedGlyphImage
properties.summary: The image to display when the marker is selected.
properties.description: The glyph image is displayed when the marker is in the selected state. This image is displayed only when the marker is selected. If you specify an image for this property, you should also specify an image in the markerGlyphImage property. Create glyph images as template images so that the glyph tint color can be applied to it. Set the size of this image to 40 by 40 points on iOS. MapKit scales images that are larger or smaller than those sizes.

properties.name: markerSubtitleVisibility
properties.summary: The visibility of the subtitle text rendered below the marker balloon.
properties.description: The subtitle text is hidden when the marker is not selected. The text is shown when the marker is selected. Use FEATURE_VISIBILITY_ADAPTIVE, FEATURE_VISIBILITY_VISIBLE or FEATURE_VISIBILITY_HIDDEN.

properties.name: markerTitleVisibility
properties.summary: The visibility of the title text rendered below the marker balloon.
properties.description: Title text is normally displayed below the marker balloon. Use FEATURE_VISIBILITY_ADAPTIVE, FEATURE_VISIBILITY_VISIBLE or FEATURE_VISIBILITY_HIDDEN.

properties.name: pincolor
properties.summary:
The color of the pin-annotation. Use the ANNOTATION_* constants for pre- defined colors, e.g ANNOTATION_GREEN.

Note for iOS: Apps running iOS 9 and later can also specify a non-constant value, e.g. "blue", "rgb(0, 0, 255 ,1)" or "#0000ff".
properties.description: Pin color is ignored if a custom pin image is specified using image.

properties.name: previewContext
properties.summary: The preview context used in the 3D-Touch feature "Peek and Pop".
properties.description:
Preview context to present the "Peek and Pop" of a view. Use an configured instance of Titanium.UI.iOS.PreviewContext here.

Note: This property can only be used on devices running iOS9 or later and supporting 3D-Touch. It is ignored on older devices and can manually be checked using forceTouchSupported.

properties.name: rightButton
properties.summary: Right button image on the annotation, specified as an image URL.

properties.name: rightView
properties.summary: Right view that is displayed on the annotation.
properties.description: This is ignored if the rightButton property is set.

properties.name: showAsMarker
properties.summary: Boolean to show an annotation view that displays a balloon-shaped marker at the designated location.
properties.description: Must be set during creation. This is ignored if the customView property is set. See the example "Map Example With Marker Annotation and Clustering".

properties.name: showInfoWindow
properties.summary: Show or hide the view that is displayed on the annotation when clicked.
properties.description: When this is false, clicking on the annotation will not center it on the map, but the annotation will still be selected, thus triggering the click event. If the annotation is selected, and the info window is hidden, then the next click will deselect the annotation, thus will NOT show the info window, regardless of the current state of this property.

properties.name: subtitle
properties.summary: Secondary title of the annotation view.

properties.name: subtitleid
properties.summary: Key in the locale file to use for the subtitle property.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Primary title of the annotation view.

properties.name: titleid
properties.summary: Key in the locale file to use for the title property.
